snippet: Almira Skripchenko, who won the French championship for the fifth time, was the top seed, but she no longer competes regularly in chess: she is a professional poker player.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column observes that although Almira Skripchenko, who won the French championship for the fifth time, was the top seed, she is a professional poker player and no longer competes regularly in chess.
lead_paragraph: Almira Skripchenko, who won the French championship for the fifth time, was the top seed, but she no longer competes regularly in chess: she is a professional poker player.

headline.seo: Chess: Skripchenko Wins French Women’s Title
headline.main: Taking a Break From Poker to Win a Championship
headline.print_headline: Taking a Break From Poker To Win a Championship
